scenes.text:
The school of Social Sciences is an internationally-recognised high-quality teaching and research centre.
We take pride in our student community and aim to provide a rewarding learning experience. 

Our world-leading teaching, informed by recent academic research, covers seven social science disciplines: Criminology, Education, Human and Social Sciences, Social Analytics, Social Policy, Social Science, and Sociology. 

Our graduates are highly employable, with opportunities for a fourth-year professional placement or study abroad.

Here at Cardiff we offer several different courses all with information that will relate directly to current events happening in the world today. 
All our undergraduate courses provide opportunities to develop skills in social science research methods, and to engage with interdisciplinary research. 

Undergraduate course we offer:
- Criminology (with Social Policy or Sociology or Law)
- Education (with Sociology or Welsh)
- Social Policy (with Criminology or Sociology)
- Sociology
- Social Science 
- Human and Social sciences 
- Social Analytics

Our school offers a range of postgraduate taught programmes in an environment renowned for world-leading research. Our modular master's programmes allow focused studies relevant to various vocations across the public, private, and third sectors. 

Students benefit from the expertise of leading researchers and scholars, receiving teaching from nationally and internationally recognized experts. Our teaching is underpinned by cutting-edge research, delivered by practicing researchers at the forefront of their fields.

Postgraduate course:
- Education
- International Criminology and Criminal Justice
- Social and Public Policy
- Social Science Research Methods
- Social Work
- Sociology
